channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14387] Compaction improvements: Maximum off-peak compaction size
item.description: Make max compaction size for peak and off peak separate config options.
item.summary: Compaction improvements: Maximum off-peak compaction size

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Patch v1. Added new compaction configuration option: hbase.hstore.compaction.max.size.offpeak - maximum selection size eligible for minor compaction during off peak hours.

hbase.hstore.compaction.max.size - this is default max if no off-peak hours are defined or if no maximum off-peak size is defined.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12767494/HBASE-14387-v1.patch
against master branch at commit c1f0442045f44fcbb3935f9244794929a5d0caea.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12767494

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.6.1 2.7.0 2.7.1)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16099//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16099//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16099//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16099//console

This message is automatically generated.

public long getMaxCompactSize(boolean mayUseOffpeak)
207 {

Code format issue

offPeakMaxCompactSize = conf.getLong(HBASE_HSTORE_COMPACTION_MAX_SIZE_OFFPEAK_KEY, Long.MAX_VALUE);

Instead u can do
offPeakMaxCompactSize = conf.getLong(HBASE_HSTORE_COMPACTION_MAX_SIZE_OFFPEAK_KEY, maxCompactSize );
Then u can avoid all the checks in getOffPeakMaxCompactSize, every time it is getting called.

Pls add a release notes.

+1
nit : The format issue is still there with getMaxCompactSize(boolean mayUseOffpeak).. Can fix on commit.

+1 after addressing Anoop Sam John nit.

Did a user ask for this Vladimir Rodionov or is it something you saw we needed in a running cluster? Thanks.

Stack

Did a user ask for this Vladimir Rodionov or is it something you saw we needed in a running cluster?

Users usually have no idea what to ask for Nope. This is good feature for those who runs cluster with automatic major compactions disabled. They now can set different limits for on-peak/off peak maximum minor compaction size. This should be documented, of course.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
New configuration option: hbase.hstore.compaction.max.size.offpeak - maximum selection size eligible for minor compaction during off peak hours.
hbase.hstore.compaction.max.size - this is default maximum if no off-peak hours are defined or if no maximum off-peak maximum size is defined.
